2.text: Buy a thick steak — anywhere from 1 1⁄2 inches (3.8 cm) to 2 inches (5.1 cm).

4.text: Let your steak reach room temperature.

5.text: If marinade or rub was not used, add salt now.

6.text: For best results, use hardwood coal.

7.text: Arrange the all the hot coals on one half of the grill.

8.text: Start the steak on the cool side of the grill, where no coals are resting.

9.text: Flip often to begin developing a crust on each side.

10.text: Use a thermometer to test for doneness.

11.text: Alternately, use the finger test to help approximate doneness.

12.text: Once the meat is about 15° F below your ideal temperature, sear it quickly on both sides to develop color.

13.text: Take your steak off the grill about 5° F before it reaches your ideal temperature.

14.text: Season with pepper and let the steak rest for at least five minutes.

16.text: Position the rack you'll be using 4 to 6 inches (10.2 to 15.2 cm) below the top of the oven.

17.text: Turn on the broiler and set a large cast-iron pan inside the oven while it's preheating.

18.text: Once the pan is finished preheating, place the steak onto the pan and broil for 3 minutes.

19.text: Flip the steak, and cook for another 3 minutes.

20.text: After 3 minutes on both sides, turn the oven down to 500° F (260° C).

21.text: Cook the steak according to the following chart.

22.text: Season with pepper and let the steak rest for at least five minutes.

24.text: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a cast-iron skillet over high heat until heavily smoking.

25.text: Add the steak to the pan, paying attention to placement if pan has raised ridges.

26.text: Flip frequently, about every minute or so, for about 6 to 12 minutes, until desired internal temperature has been reached.

27.text: Before doneness has been reached, add 2 tablespoons of butter and any additional aromatics.

28.text: After steak is cooked (steak will continue to cook off the heat), allow it to rest for at least five minutes.
